fields.description: A positive integer representing the amount to subtract from an invoice total (required if percent_off is not passed).
fields.name: amount off

fields.description: Specifies how long the discount will be in effect if used on a subscription. Can be forever, once, or repeating. Defaults to once.
fields.name: duration

fields.description: Required only if duration is repeating, in which case it must be a positive integer that specifies the number of months the discount will be in effect.
fields.name: duration in months

fields.description: A positive integer specifying the number of times the coupon can be redeemed before it's no longer valid. For example, you might have a 50% off coupon that the first 20 readers of your blog can use.
fields.name: max redemptions

fields.description: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on, for instance invoices, or receipts. By default the id is shown if name is not set.
fields.name: name

fields.description: A positive float larger than 0, and smaller or equal to 100, that represents the discount the coupon will apply (required if amount_off is not passed).
fields.name: percent off

fields.description: Whether the price can be used for new purchases. Defaults to true.
fields.name: active

fields.description: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in unit_amount or unit_amount_decimal) will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes.
fields.name: billing scheme

fields.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.
fields.name: currency

fields.description: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string. This may be up to 200 characters.
fields.name: lookup key

fields.description: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.
fields.name: nickname

fields.description: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed.
fields.name: tax behavior

fields.description: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows.
fields.name: tiers mode

fields.description: If set to true, will atomically remove the lookup key from the existing price, and assign it to this price.
fields.name: transfer lookup key

fields.description: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.
fields.name: unit amount

fields.description: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.
fields.name: unit amount decimal

fields.description: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for plans of usage_type=metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum.
fields.name: aggregate usage

fields.description: Interval (or event) to which the amount applies.
fields.name: interval

fields.description: The number of intervals between payments. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 indicates one payment every three months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks). This parameter is optional when interval=sporadic.
fields.name: interval count

fields.description: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed.
fields.name: usage type

fields.description: Divide usage by this number.
fields.name: divide by

fields.description: After division, either round the result up or down.
fields.name: round

fields.description: Whether the price can be used for new purchases. Defaults to true.
fields.name: active

fields.description: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in unit_amount or unit_amount_decimal) will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes.
fields.name: billing scheme

fields.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.
fields.name: currency

fields.description: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string. This may be up to 200 characters.
fields.name: lookup key

fields.description: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.
fields.name: nickname

fields.description: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed.
fields.name: tax behavior

fields.description: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows.
fields.name: tiers mode

fields.description: If set to true, will atomically remove the lookup key from the existing price, and assign it to this price.
fields.name: transfer lookup key

fields.description: A positive integer in cents (or local equivalent) (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.
fields.name: unit amount

fields.description: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in cents (or local equivalent) with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.
fields.name: unit amount decimal

fields.description: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for plans of usage_type=metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum.
fields.name: aggregate usage

fields.description: Interval (or event) to which the amount applies.
fields.name: interval

fields.description: The number of intervals between payments. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 indicates one payment every three months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks). This parameter is optional when interval=sporadic.
fields.name: interval count

fields.description: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed.
fields.name: usage type

fields.description: Divide usage by this number.
fields.name: divide by

fields.description: After division, either round the result up or down.
fields.name: round

fields.description: The quantity you'd like to apply to the subscription item you're creating.
fields.name: quantity

fields.description: This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account.
fields.name: application fee percent

fields.description: Determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.
fields.name: billing cycle anchor

fields.description: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions.
fields.name: collection method

fields.description: A coupon contains information about a percent-off or amount-off discount you might want to apply to a customer. Coupons may be applied to subscriptions, invoices, checkout sessions, quotes, and more. Coupons do not work with conventional one-off charges or payment intents.
fields.name: coupon

fields.description: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.
fields.name: default payment method

fields.description: End date of the mandate or subscription. If not provided, the mandate will be active until canceled. If provided, end date should be after start date.
fields.name: end date

fields.description: If the subscription has a trial, the end of that trial.
fields.name: trial end

fields.description: Whether Stripe automatically computes tax on this invoice.
fields.name: enabled

fields.description: Whether Stripe automatically computes tax on this invoice.
fields.name: enabled

fields.description: Number of days within which a customer must pay invoices generated by this quote. This value will be null for quotes where collection_method=charge_automatically.
fields.name: days until due

fields.description: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount will be transferred to the destination.
fields.name: amount percent

fields.description: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account to transfer funds to if transfer_data was specified in the charge request.
fields.name: destination

fields.description: Configures how the subscription schedule behaves when it ends. Possible values are release or cancel with the default being release. release will end the subscription schedule and keep the underlying subscription running.cancel will end the subscription schedule and cancel the underlying subscription.
fields.name: end behavior

fields.description: Migrate an existing subscription to be managed by a subscription schedule. If this parameter is set, a subscription schedule will be created using the subscription's item(s), set to auto-renew using the subscription's interval. When using this parameter, other parameters (such as phase values) cannot be set. To create a subscription schedule with other modifications, we recommend making two separate API calls.
fields.name: from subscription

fields.description: When the subscription schedule starts. We recommend using now so that it starts the subscription immediately. You can also use a Unix timestamp to backdate the subscription so that it starts on a past date, or set a future date for the subscription to start on.
fields.name: start date

fields.description: This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account.
fields.name: application fee percent

fields.description: Determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.
fields.name: billing cycle anchor

fields.description: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions.
fields.name: collection method

fields.description: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.
fields.name: default payment method

fields.description: The total invoice amount threshold boundary if it triggered the threshold invoice.
fields.name: amount gte

fields.description: Indicates if the billing_cycle_anchor should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_cycle_anchor will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged. This value may not be true if the subscription contains items with plans that have aggregate_usage=last_ever.
fields.name: reset billing cycle anchor

fields.description: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount will be transferred to the destination.
fields.name: amount percent

fields.description: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account to transfer funds to if transfer_data was specified in the charge request.
fields.name: destination

fields.description: Whether Stripe automatically computes tax on this invoice.
fields.name: enabled

fields.description: Number of days within which a customer must pay invoices generated by this quote. This value will be null for quotes where collection_method=charge_automatically.
fields.name: days until due

fields.description: Invoice rendering template id to use for this subscription's invoice
fields.name: template

fields.description: Version of the rendering template that will be used. If this field is null, then the latest version of the template will be automatically used.
fields.name: template version

fields.description: This is used to determine the number of billing cycles to prebill.
fields.name: iterations

fields.description: Id of the customized feedback option that provide deeper insight into why the subscription was canceled.
fields.name: feedback option

fields.description: Additional comments about why the user canceled the subscription, if the subscription was canceled explicitly by the user.
fields.name: comment

fields.description: The customer submitted reason for why they canceled, if the subscription was canceled explicitly by the user.
fields.name: feedback

fields.description: Whether the product is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.
fields.name: active

fields.description: The product's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store a long form explanation of the product being sold for your own rendering purposes.
fields.name: description

fields.description: The product's name, meant to be displayable to the customer.
fields.name: name

fields.description: Whether this product is shipped (i.e., physical goods).
fields.name: shippable

fields.description:
An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card or bank statement. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.

This may be up to 22 characters. The statement description may not include <, >, \, ", ' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. It must contain at least one letter.
fields.name: statement descriptor

fields.description: A tax code ID.
fields.name: tax code

fields.description: A label that represents units of this product in Stripe and on customers’ receipts and invoices. When set, this will be included in associated invoice line item descriptions.
fields.name: unit label

fields.description: A URL of a publicly-accessible webpage for this product.
fields.name: url

fields.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.
fields.name: currency

fields.description: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes. One of inclusive, exclusive, or unspecified. Once specified as either inclusive or exclusive, it cannot be changed.
fields.name: tax behavior

fields.description: The cost of each unit of product being credited.
fields.name: unit amount

fields.description: Same as unit_amount, but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.
fields.name: unit amount decimal

fields.description: Interval (or event) to which the amount applies.
fields.name: interval

fields.description: The number of intervals between payments. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 indicates one payment every three months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks). This parameter is optional when interval=sporadic.
fields.name: interval count

fields.description: Height, in inches.
fields.name: height

fields.description: Length, in inches.
fields.name: length

fields.description: Weight, in ounces.
fields.name: weight

fields.description: Width, in inches.
fields.name: width

fields.description: An integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) that represents the customer's current balance, which affect the customer's future invoices. A negative amount represents a credit that decreases the amount due on an invoice; a positive amount increases the amount due on an invoice.
fields.name: balance

fields.description: A coupon contains information about a percent-off or amount-off discount you might want to apply to a customer. Coupons may be applied to subscriptions, invoices, checkout sessions, quotes, and more. Coupons do not work with conventional one-off charges or payment intents.
fields.name: coupon

fields.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object. It is displayed alongside the customer in the dashboard.
fields.name: description

fields.description: Customer's email address. It's displayed alongside the customer in your dashboard and can be useful for searching and tracking. This may be up to 512 characters.
fields.name: email

fields.description: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be 3–12 uppercase letters or numbers.
fields.name: invoice prefix

fields.description: The customer's full name or business name.
fields.name: name

fields.description: The sequence to be used on the customer's next invoice. Defaults to 1.
fields.name: next invoice sequence

fields.description: ID of the payment method used in this charge.
fields.name: payment method

fields.description: The customer's phone number.
fields.name: phone

fields.description: The API ID of a promotion code to apply to the customer. The customer will have a discount applied on all recurring payments. Charges you create through the API will not have the discount.
fields.name: promotion code

fields.description: The source object for errors returned on a request involving a source.
fields.name: source

fields.description: The customer's tax exemption. One of none, exempt, or reverse.
fields.name: tax exempt

fields.description: ID of the test clock to attach to the customer.
fields.name: test clock

fields.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.
fields.name: city

fields.description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).
fields.name: country

fields.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).
fields.name: line1

fields.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).
fields.name: line2

fields.description: ZIP or postal code.
fields.name: postal code

fields.description: State, county, province, or region.
fields.name: state

fields.description: The configuration for how funds that land in the customer cash balance are reconciled.
fields.name: reconciliation mode

fields.description: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.
fields.name: default payment method

fields.description: Footer displayed on the invoice.
fields.name: footer

fields.description: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc.
fields.name: carrier

fields.description: Recipient name.
fields.name: name

fields.description: Recipient phone (including extension).
fields.name: phone

fields.description: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.
fields.name: tracking number

fields.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.
fields.name: city

fields.description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).
fields.name: country

fields.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).
fields.name: line1

fields.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).
fields.name: line2

fields.description: ZIP or postal code.
fields.name: postal code

fields.description: State, county, province, or region.
fields.name: state
